column1: Feargus Urquhart (born 19 April 1970) is a Scottish video game designer and CEO of Obsidian Entertainment.
Urquhart is best known for his work at Interplay Entertainment
column2: particularly as leader of Black Isle Studios
column3: Interplay's internal role-playing video game division which Urquhart established in 1997. With them
column4: Urquhart worked on the first two Fallout games. In 1999
column5: IGN's RPG Vault gave him the award for an Unsung Hero of the Year
column6: stating that "since he is always quick to deflect credit away from himself
column7: the great majority of fans remain unaware of Feargus' actual contributions to Black Isle's titles. We won't give away his secrets other than to say we consider him a very worthy initial winner of this award."When Interplay ran into financial difficulties and Black Isle's future became uncertain
column8: Urquhart and several other industry veterans departed to found Obsidian Entertainment in 2003.Urquhart lives in West Irvine
column9: California. He and his wife Margo have two children: Katie and Aidan.
